chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Montavius L Everton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA'S are authorized.  Absolute sobriety. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and follow through and domestic violence training. No contact  with child or mother of child until domestic violence training is complete. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law within 60 days of release from Racine County Jail and pay for the testing.  Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: time currently being served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UAS' are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as a psychological evaluation. Must follow through with all recommendations of psychological evaluation. No contact with IG, JW. or TC until after domestic violence treatment is completed and they agree to have contact. Any contact must be approved by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay any and all costs still owing.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defense indicates no additions or corrections to revocation packet.

State recommends 4 years WPS (2 IC & 2 ES) with treatment as ordered in original sentence. 
Defense requests 3 years WPS (18 months IC & 18 months ES).

full time employment
DNA sample

Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $3,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim, ISG, (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Montavius L Everton in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Montavius L Everton in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
